items.sentence: Tom and Mary sat on a bench in the park talking to each other.
Tom and Mary sat on the couch, flipping through a photo album.
Are you going to buy that dress you were looking at yesterday?
Tom left early this morning, so he should be in Boston by now.
When you\'ve finished reading that book, I\'d like to read it.
I\'ve been trying to get a hold of you for the past two hours.
It was difficult for me to find the entrance to that building.
Tom got lost in the woods and ended up in someone\'s backyard.
Tom grabbed Mary\'s fishing pole to help her pull in the fish.
You should be able to do that without anyone\'s help, I think.
Do you know whether or not Tom is going to Boston next summer?
I think you ought to let Tom and me go to Boston by ourselves.
I thought it would be fun to live in Boston for a year or two.
I told Tom he should consider taking the job Mary offered him.
I used to make sure I put a cover over my motorcycle at night.
I saw Tom yesterday in a restaurant. He was talking to a girl.
Tom was rescued after being trapped six days in the mountains.
Tom would still be alive if he had been wearing his seat belt.
Some people say Tom is stupid, but I think he\'s pretty smart.
Someone spoke to me in French, but I couldn\'t understand him.
Tom was going to go to Boston to see Mary, but decided not to.
Tom would like to go on the picnic, too. We should invite him.
Tom wants to know when we\'re going to come over and help him.
Tom was the only one who didn\'t hand in his homework on time.
Tom\'s fingers got smashed while working on the assembly line.
Tom got a lot of mosquito bites the last time he went camping.
Tom had been walking for hours and was beginning to get tired.
Tom has locked himself in his bedroom and refuses to come out.
I doubt that Tom would behave in the way you suggested he did.
Who\'s going to be responsible for making sure that gets done?
Tom doesn\'t think that he has anything to do with the matter.
I want to get into shape, so I\'ve been working out every day.
I\'m willing to take care of your children, if you want me to.
I didn\'t have anything else to do, so I thought I\'d drop by.
Tom pulled something out of his pocket and put it on his desk.
Tom put new strings on the old guitar that he had just bought.
Tom said it took him a little while to get used to doing this.
Just do what I did when I met Mary. Tell her she\'s beautiful.
Tom has to do better on the next test or he\'ll fail my class.
From what I\'ve seen of the product so far, it\'s pretty good.
I can\'t believe that Tom said such hateful things about Mary.
I can\'t believe you really want to live here all by yourself.
My father usually drinks beer, but this evening he drank wine.
If you want to go, go. If you don\'t want to, that\'s OK, too.
Tom talked Mary into baking a cake for John\'s birthday party.
If Tom had made that investment, he\'d be a billionaire today.
Tom should\'ve listened more carefully to Mary\'s explanation.
Tom should\'ve told Mary that she wasn\'t supposed to do that.
At that point, I was afraid something bad was going to happen.
If he had taken his doctor\'s advice, he might still be alive.
